title: ArchiMate 3.2 Element Reference
description: Complete reference of all ArchiMate 3.2 elements organized by layer

Motivation.description: Elements that represent the context or change drivers for the enterprise

Stakeholder.description: An individual, team, or organization that has interests in, or concerns relative to, the outcome of the architecture
Stakeholder.usage: Use to represent people or organizations who influence or are influenced by the architecture

Driver.description: An external or internal condition that motivates an organization to define its goals and implement the changes necessary to achieve them
Driver.usage: Use to represent forces that create motivation for change

Assessment.description: The outcome of an analysis of the state of affairs of the enterprise with respect to some driver
Assessment.usage: Use to represent evaluation results or analysis outcomes

Goal.description: A high-level statement of intent, direction, or desired end state for an organization and its stakeholders
Goal.usage: Use to represent what the organization wants to achieve

Outcome.description: An end result that has been or will be achieved
Outcome.usage: Use to represent specific measurable results

Principle.description: A normative property of all systems in a given context, or the way in which they are realized
Principle.usage: Use to represent fundamental rules or guidelines

Requirement.description: A statement of need defining what a particular product or service should do or how it should perform
Requirement.usage: Use to represent specific needs that must be fulfilled
examples: Data must be encrypted at rest

Constraint.description: A factor that prevents or obstructs the realization of goals
Constraint.usage: Use to represent limitations or restrictions

Meaning.description: The knowledge or expertise present in, or the interpretation given to, a concept in a particular context
Meaning.usage: Use to represent semantic content or interpretation

Value.description: The relative worth, utility, or importance of a concept
Value.usage: Use to represent what is valuable to stakeholders

Strategy.description: Elements that represent the strategic direction and choices of the enterprise

Resource.description: An asset owned or controlled by an individual or organization
Resource.usage: Use to represent strategic assets and capabilities

Capability.description: An ability that an active structure element possesses
Capability.usage: Use to represent what the organization can do

CourseOfAction.description: An approach or plan for configuring some capabilities and resources of the enterprise
CourseOfAction.usage: Use to represent strategic approaches or initiatives

ValueStream.description: A sequence of activities that create an overall result for a customer, stakeholder, or end user
ValueStream.usage: Use to represent end-to-end value delivery processes

Business.description: Elements that represent business processes, functions, events, and actors

BusinessActor.description: A person, organizational unit, or external party that plays a role in business processes
BusinessActor.usage: Use to represent who performs business activities

BusinessRole.description: The responsibility for performing specific behavior, to which an actor can be assigned
BusinessRole.usage: Use to represent roles that actors can play

BusinessCollaboration.description: An aggregate of two or more business internal active structure elements that work together
BusinessCollaboration.usage: Use to represent groups working together

BusinessInterface.description: A point of access where business services are made available to the environment
BusinessInterface.usage: Use to represent how business services are accessed

BusinessProcess.description: A sequence of business behaviors that achieves a specific outcome
BusinessProcess.usage: Use to represent end-to-end business workflows

BusinessFunction.description: A collection of business behavior based on chosen set of criteria
BusinessFunction.usage: Use to represent business capabilities or departments

BusinessInteraction.description: A unit of collective business behavior performed by two or more business actors
BusinessInteraction.usage: Use to represent collaborative business activities

BusinessEvent.description: A business behavior element that denotes an organizational state change
BusinessEvent.usage: Use to represent significant business occurrences

BusinessService.description: An explicitly defined exposed business behavior
BusinessService.usage: Use to represent services provided to customers or other parts of the organization

BusinessObject.description: A concept used within a particular business domain
BusinessObject.usage: Use to represent business information or concepts

Contract.description: A formal or informal specification of agreement between a provider and consumer
Contract.usage: Use to represent agreements and SLAs

Representation.description: A perceptible form of the information carried by a business object
Representation.usage: Use to represent how business objects are represented

Product.description: A coherent collection of services and/or passive structure elements
Product.usage: Use to represent what the organization offers to customers

Application.description: Elements that represent application components, services, and interfaces

ApplicationComponent.description: An encapsulation of application functionality aligned to implementation structure
ApplicationComponent.usage: Use to represent software applications or major modules

ApplicationCollaboration.description: An aggregate of two or more application components that work together
ApplicationCollaboration.usage: Use to represent applications working together

ApplicationInterface.description: A point of access where application services are made available
ApplicationInterface.usage: Use to represent how applications expose their functionality

ApplicationFunction.description: Automated behavior that can be performed by an application component
ApplicationFunction.usage: Use to represent what applications can do

ApplicationInteraction.description: A unit of collective application behavior performed by two or more application components
ApplicationInteraction.usage: Use to represent applications working together

ApplicationProcess.description: A sequence of application behaviors that achieves a specific outcome

ApplicationEvent.description: An application behavior element that denotes an application state change
ApplicationEvent.usage: Use to represent significant application events

ApplicationService.description: An explicitly defined exposed application behavior
ApplicationService.usage: Use to represent services provided by applications

DataObject.usage: Use to represent application data structures

Technology.description: Elements that represent technology infrastructure and platforms

Node.description: A computational or physical resource that hosts, manipulates, or interacts with other computational or physical resources
Node.usage: Use to represent servers, devices, or computational resources

Device.description: A physical IT resource upon which system software and artifacts may be stored or deployed
Device.usage: Use to represent physical computing hardware

SystemSoftware.description: Software that provides or contributes to an environment for storing, executing, and using software or data

TechnologyCollaboration.description: An aggregate of two or more nodes that work together
TechnologyCollaboration.usage: Use to represent technology components working together

TechnologyInterface.description: A point of access where technology services are made available
TechnologyInterface.usage: Use to represent technology access points

Path.description: A link between two or more nodes, through which these nodes can exchange data or material

CommunicationNetwork.description: A set of structures that connects computer systems or other electronic devices
CommunicationNetwork.usage: Use to represent networks that enable communication

TechnologyFunction.description: A collection of technology behavior based on a chosen set of criteria

TechnologyProcess.description: A sequence of technology behaviors that achieves a specific outcome
TechnologyProcess.usage: Use to represent automated technology processes

TechnologyInteraction.description: A unit of collective technology behavior performed by two or more nodes
TechnologyInteraction.usage: Use to represent technology components interacting

TechnologyEvent.description: A technology behavior element that denotes a technology state change

TechnologyService.description: An explicitly defined exposed technology behavior
TechnologyService.usage: Use to represent services provided by technology

Artifact.description: A piece of data that is used or produced in a software development process
Artifact.usage: Use to represent deployable software items

Physical.description: Elements that represent physical elements like equipment and facilities

Equipment.description: One or more physical machines, tools, or instruments that can create, use, store, move, or transform materials
Equipment.usage: Use to represent physical machinery or tools

Facility.usage: Use to represent buildings or physical spaces

DistributionNetwork.description: A physical network used to transport materials or energy
DistributionNetwork.usage: Use to represent physical distribution systems

Material.usage: Use to represent physical materials or energy

Location.description: A conceptual point or extent in space

Implementation.description: Elements that represent implementation and migration planning

WorkPackage.description: A series of actions identified and designed to achieve specific results within specified time and resource constraints
WorkPackage.usage: Use to represent project work packages or phases

Deliverable.description: A precisely-defined outcome of a work package

ImplementationEvent.description: A state change related to implementation or migration
ImplementationEvent.usage: Use to represent implementation milestones or events

Plateau.description: A relatively stable state of the architecture that exists during a limited period of time
Plateau.usage: Use to represent architecture states during migration

Gap.description: A statement of difference between two plateaus
Gap.usage: Use to represent differences between architecture states

usage_tips: Start with business layer elements to model business processes and actors
Use application layer to represent supporting software systems
Add technology layer to show underlying infrastructure
Connect layers with serving and realization relationships
Use motivation layer to capture drivers and requirements
Group related elements to reduce diagram complexity
